page.title: 01GENERAL INFORMATION LEVEN
page.content: { LEVEN, }North Humberside, lies on the flat coastal plain of Holderness. The area covered by the survey contains the village,outlying farms,mainly arable land & a canal used for recreatioal activities. The village is situated 6 miles N.E. of Beverley,6 miles W. of Hornsea. The land is very flat, no point in the village being higher than 5m. above sea level. Leven is bisected by the{A165}road running from Hull (12 miles) S. to Bridlington in a N.E. direction. The village lies E.& W. the major road & in the triangle formed by the {B1245 & {B1244}. In 1981 the population was 1708 of which 16% were pensioners & 7% were under 5yrs. There were 621 households 85% being owner occupied.
